verses.verse: Now Jephthah <WH3316> the Gileadite <WH1569> was a mighty man <WH1368> of valour <WH2428>, and he was the son <WH1121> of an harlot <WH802> <WH2181>: and Gilead <WH1568> begat <WH3205> Jephthah <WH3316>.

And Gilead's <WH1568> wife <WH802> bare <WH3205> him sons <WH1121>; and his wife's <WH802> sons <WH1121> grew up <WH1431>, and they thrust out <WH1644> Jephthah <WH3316>, and said <WH559> unto him, Thou shalt not inherit <WH5157> in our father's <WH1> house <WH1004>; for thou art the son <WH1121> of a strange <WH312> woman <WH802>.

Then Jephthah <WH3316> fled <WH1272> from <WH6440> his brethren <WH251>, and dwelt <WH3427> in the land <WH776> of Tob <WH2897>: and there were gathered <WH3950> vain <WH7386> men <WH582> to Jephthah <WH3316>, and went out <WH3318> with him.
¶ And it came to pass in process of time <WH3117>, that the children <WH1121> of Ammon <WH5983> made war <WH3898> against Israel <WH3478>.

And it was so, that when the children <WH1121> of Ammon <WH5983> made war <WH3898> against Israel <WH3478>, the elders <WH2205> of Gilead <WH1568> went <WH3212> to fetch <WH3947> Jephthah <WH3316> out of the land <WH776> of Tob <WH2897>:
And they said <WH559> unto Jephthah <WH3316>, Come <WH3212>, and be our captain <WH7101>, that we may fight <WH3898> with the children <WH1121> of Ammon <WH5983>.

And Jephthah <WH3316> said <WH559> unto the elders <WH2205> of Gilead <WH1568>, Did not ye hate <WH8130> me, and expel <WH1644> me out of my father's <WH1> house <WH1004>? and why are ye come <WH935> unto me now when ye are in distress <WH6887>?

And the elders <WH2205> of Gilead <WH1568> said <WH559> unto Jephthah <WH3316>, Therefore we turn again <WH7725> to thee now, that thou mayest go <WH1980> with us, and fight <WH3898> against the children <WH1121> of Ammon <WH5983>, and be our head <WH7218> over all the inhabitants <WH3427> of Gilead <WH1568>.

And Jephthah <WH3316> said <WH559> unto the elders <WH2205> of Gilead <WH1568>, If ye bring me home again <WH7725> to fight <WH3898> against the children <WH1121> of Ammon <WH5983>, and the LORD <WH3068> deliver <WH5414> them before <WH6440> me, shall I be your head <WH7218>?
And the elders <WH2205> of Gilead <WH1568> said <WH559> unto Jephthah <WH3316>, The LORD <WH3068> be witness <WH8085> between us, if we do <WH6213> not so according to thy words <WH1697>.

Then Jephthah <WH3316> went <WH3212> with the elders <WH2205> of Gilead <WH1568>, and the people <WH5971> made <WH7760> him head <WH7218> and captain <WH7101> over them: and Jephthah <WH3316> uttered <WH1696> all his words <WH1697> before <WH6440> the LORD <WH3068> in Mizpeh <WH4709>.

¶ And Jephthah <WH3316> sent <WH7971> messengers <WH4397> unto the king <WH4428> of the children <WH1121> of Ammon <WH5983>, saying <WH559>, What hast thou to do with me, that thou art come <WH935> against me to fight <WH3898> in my land <WH776>?

And the king <WH4428> of the children <WH1121> of Ammon <WH5983> answered <WH559> unto the messengers <WH4397> of Jephthah <WH3316>, Because Israel <WH3478> took away <WH3947> my land <WH776>, when they came up <WH5927> out of Egypt <WH4714>, from Arnon <WH769> even unto Jabbok <WH2999>, and unto Jordan <WH3383>: now therefore restore those lands again <WH7725> peaceably <WH7965>.
And Jephthah <WH3316> sent <WH7971> messengers <WH4397> again <WH3254> unto the king <WH4428> of the children <WH1121> of Ammon <WH5983>:

And said <WH559> unto him, Thus saith <WH559> Jephthah <WH3316>, Israel <WH3478> took not away <WH3947> the land <WH776> of Moab <WH4124>, nor the land <WH776> of the children <WH1121> of Ammon <WH5983>:
But when Israel <WH3478> came up <WH5927> from Egypt <WH4714>, and walked <WH3212> through the wilderness <WH4057> unto the Red <WH5488> sea <WH3220>, and came <WH935> to Kadesh <WH6946>;

Then Israel <WH3478> sent <WH7971> messengers <WH4397> unto the king <WH4428> of Edom <WH123>, saying <WH559>, Let me, I pray thee, pass through <WH5674> thy land <WH776>: but the king <WH4428> of Edom <WH123> would not hearken <WH8085> thereto. And in like manner they sent <WH7971> unto the king <WH4428> of Moab <WH4124>: but he would <WH14> not consent: and Israel <WH3478> abode <WH3427> in Kadesh <WH6946>.

Then they went along <WH3212> through the wilderness <WH4057>, and compassed <WH5437> the land <WH776> of Edom <WH123>, and the land <WH776> of Moab <WH4124>, and came <WH935> by the east side <WH4217> <WH8121> of the land <WH776> of Moab <WH4124>, and pitched <WH2583> on the other side <WH5676> of Arnon <WH769>, but came <WH935> not within the border <WH1366> of Moab <WH4124>: for Arnon <WH769> was the border <WH1366> of Moab <WH4124>.

And Israel <WH3478> sent <WH7971> messengers <WH4397> unto Sihon <WH5511> king <WH4428> of the Amorites <WH567>, the king <WH4428> of Heshbon <WH2809>; and Israel <WH3478> said <WH559> unto him, Let us pass <WH5674>, we pray thee, through thy land <WH776> into <WH5704> my place <WH4725>.

But Sihon <WH5511> trusted <WH539> not Israel <WH3478> to pass <WH5674> through his coast <WH1366>: but Sihon <WH5511> gathered <WH622> all his people <WH5971> together <WH622>, and pitched <WH2583> in Jahaz <WH3096>, and fought <WH3898> against Israel <WH3478>.

And the LORD <WH3068> God <WH430> of Israel <WH3478> delivered <WH5414> Sihon <WH5511> and all his people <WH5971> into the hand <WH3027> of Israel <WH3478>, and they smote <WH5221> them: so Israel <WH3478> possessed <WH3423> all the land <WH776> of the Amorites <WH567>, the inhabitants <WH3427> of that country <WH776>.
And they possessed <WH3423> all the coasts <WH1366> of the Amorites <WH567>, from Arnon <WH769> even unto Jabbok <WH2999>, and from the wilderness <WH4057> even unto Jordan <WH3383>.

So now the LORD <WH3068> God <WH430> of Israel <WH3478> hath dispossessed <WH3423> the Amorites <WH567> from before <WH6440> his people <WH5971> Israel <WH3478>, and shouldest thou possess <WH3423> it?

Wilt not thou possess <WH3423> that which Chemosh <WH3645> thy god <WH430> giveth thee to possess <WH3423>? So whomsoever the LORD <WH3068> our God <WH430> shall drive out <WH3423> from before <WH6440> us, them will we possess <WH3423>.

And now art thou any thing better <WH2896> than Balak <WH1111> the son <WH1121> of Zippor <WH6834>, king <WH4428> of Moab <WH4124>? did he ever <WH7378> strive <WH7378> against Israel <WH3478>, or did he ever <WH3898> fight <WH3898> against them,

While Israel <WH3478> dwelt <WH3427> in Heshbon <WH2809> and her towns <WH1323>, and in Aroer <WH6177> and her towns <WH1323>, and in all the cities <WH5892> that be along by the coasts <WH3027> of Arnon <WH769>, three <WH7969> hundred <WH3967> years <WH8141>? why therefore did ye not recover <WH5337> them within that time <WH6256>?

Wherefore I have not sinned <WH2398> against thee, but thou doest <WH6213> <WH853> me wrong <WH7451> to war <WH3898> against me: the LORD <WH3068> the Judge <WH8199> be judge <WH8199> this day <WH3117> between the children <WH1121> of Israel <WH3478> and the children <WH1121> of Ammon <WH5983>.
Howbeit the king <WH4428> of the children <WH1121> of Ammon <WH5983> hearkened <WH8085> not unto the words <WH1697> of Jephthah <WH3316> which he sent <WH7971> him.

¶ Then the Spirit <WH7307> of the LORD <WH3068> came upon Jephthah <WH3316>, and he passed over <WH5674> Gilead <WH1568>, and Manasseh <WH4519>, and passed over <WH5674> Mizpeh <WH4708> of Gilead <WH1568>, and from Mizpeh <WH4708> of Gilead <WH1568> he passed over <WH5674> unto the children <WH1121> of Ammon <WH5983>.

And Jephthah <WH3316> vowed <WH5087> a vow <WH5088> unto the LORD <WH3068>, and said <WH559>, If thou shalt without fail <WH5414> deliver <WH5414> the children <WH1121> of Ammon <WH5983> into mine hands <WH3027>,

Then it shall be, that whatsoever <WH3318> cometh forth <WH3318> of the doors <WH1817> of my house <WH1004> to meet <WH7125> me, when I return <WH7725> in peace <WH7965> from the children <WH1121> of Ammon <WH5983>, shall surely be the LORD's <WH3068>, and I will offer it up <WH5927> for a burnt offering <WH5930>.
¶ So Jephthah <WH3316> passed over <WH5674> unto the children <WH1121> of Ammon <WH5983> to fight <WH3898> against them; and the LORD <WH3068> delivered <WH5414> them into his hands <WH3027>.

And he smote <WH5221> them from Aroer <WH6177>, even till thou come <WH935> to Minnith <WH4511>, even twenty <WH6242> cities <WH5892>, and unto the plain <WH58> of the vineyards <WH3754> <WH64>, with a very <WH3966> great <WH1419> slaughter <WH4347>. Thus the children <WH1121> of Ammon <WH5983> were subdued <WH3665> before <WH6440> the children <WH1121> of Israel <WH3478>.

¶ And Jephthah <WH3316> came <WH935> to Mizpeh <WH4709> unto his house <WH1004>, and, behold, his daughter <WH1323> came out <WH3318> to meet <WH7125> him with timbrels <WH8596> and with dances <WH4246>: and she was his only child <WH3173>; beside her he had neither son <WH1121> nor <WH176> daughter <WH1323>.

And it came to pass, when he saw <WH7200> her, that he rent <WH7167> his clothes <WH899>, and said <WH559>, Alas <WH162>, my daughter <WH1323>! thou hast brought <WH3766> me very <WH3766> low <WH3766>, and thou art one of them that trouble <WH5916> me: for I have opened <WH6475> my mouth <WH6310> unto the LORD <WH3068>, and I cannot <WH3201> go back <WH7725>.

And she said <WH559> unto him, My father <WH1>, if thou hast opened <WH6475> thy mouth <WH6310> unto the LORD <WH3068>, do <WH6213> to me according to that which <WH834> hath proceeded <WH3318> out of thy mouth <WH6310>; forasmuch <WH310> as the LORD <WH3068> hath taken <WH6213> vengeance <WH5360> for thee of thine enemies <WH341>, even of the children <WH1121> of Ammon <WH5983>.

And she said <WH559> unto her father <WH1>, Let this thing <WH1697> be done <WH6213> for me: let me alone <WH7503> two <WH8147> months <WH2320>, that I may go up <WH3212> and down <WH3381> upon the mountains <WH2022>, and bewail <WH1058> my virginity <WH1331>, I and my fellows <WH7464> <WH7474>.

And he said <WH559>, Go <WH3212>. And he sent her away <WH7971> for two <WH8147> months <WH2320>: and she went <WH3212> with her companions <WH7464>, and bewailed <WH1058> her virginity <WH1331> upon the mountains <WH2022>.

And it came to pass at the end <WH7093> of two <WH8147> months <WH2320>, that she returned <WH7725> unto her father <WH1>, who did <WH6213> with her according to his vow <WH5088> which he had vowed <WH5087>: and she knew <WH3045> no man <WH376>. And it was a custom <WH2706> in Israel <WH3478>,

That the daughters <WH1323> of Israel <WH3478> went <WH3212> yearly <WH3117> <WH3117> to lament <WH8567> the daughter <WH1323> of Jephthah <WH3316> the Gileadite <WH1569> four <WH702> days <WH3117> in a year <WH8141>.
